caption: Climate change is an evergrowing issue in today's world, projected to worsen and deeply impact our environment and daily lives.
Those in under-developed countries will be the most affected, facing water and food shortages.
To address this, the UN has launched a set of regulations to combat Climate Change under the 2030 SDG agenda.
These include strengthening resilience to climate disasters, integrating climate policies, raising awareness, and global cooperation through the Paris Agreement.
Together, these initiatives support renewables, sustainable cities, and protect vulnerable communities for a low-carbon future.
Modern water meters offer real-time monitoring of household and industrial usage.
In Makers Valley, we’re piloting smart water meters that alert communities when leaks occur, helping conserve water and save costs.
Over 2.2 billion people lack access to safe drinking water globally.
The UN’s SDG 6 aims to ensure availability and sustainable management of water for all by 2030.
We’re supporting community-driven systems that track water stress, availability, and usage trends in real-time.
Aging infrastructure often leads to high water loss.
Our smart dashboards integrate IoT sensors to detect pipeline issues early — preventing waste and protecting the supply chain.
